['bib']abstract: The objective of this paper is to empirically evaluate OOmFPWeb, a functional size measurement procedure for Web applications. ['bib']abstract: The purpose of this dissertation is to present a simple, sizing model that will explain the" essence" of software size. To this end the dissertation presents the Data-Operator Sizing Model (DOSM). The DOSM defines a process as an n-tuple consisting of an operator object and one or more data objects. Estimating the size of a process consists of counting its sub-processes. The model explains how processes may be disaggregated into sub-processes.
['bib']title: Software size estimation: Experiments with data and operator objects
